title: Textile, "La Visite du Pasteur", mid-19th century
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by engraved roller on plain weave
dimensions:
Warp: 85cm (33 1/2in.)
Weft: 82 cm (32 1/4in.) (Both selvedges present).
Height of repeat: 55cm (21 1/2in.)
description: Three different scenes, in sepia on white. All the designs are taken from plate sources and are reversed. The original  was printed by Favre Petitpierre et Cie. in Nantes about 1815 and was called 'The Scottish Shepherds'.
